    For the first choice : PHP MAil
    the system will use the builtin PHP functionality to send mails
    If you chose it, send test mail to be sure that is working.
    and you don't want to do any special action more.

    What is SMTP?

    SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is a protocol for sending email messages between
    servers. Most email systems that send mail over the Internet use SMTP to send messages from
    one server to another, and to deliver messages to local mail clients like Microsoft Outlook
    or Apple Mail.

    SMTP is a communication protocol used to send and receive email messages. It is the backbone
    of the email system and is responsible for relaying email messages from the sender's server
    to the recipient's server, and then delivering them to the recipient's email inbox. SMTP is
    a text-based protocol,
    which means that it uses plain text to communicate with email servers.

    Number1: Host: It is the server IP host or Domain: EX: mail.google.com
    Number2: Port: It is communication port between the servers EX: 25, 578
    Number3: Encryption: It is communication between the servers, to check the connection is secure or not type EX: SSL, TLS
    Number5: Username: It is login authentication for the server EX: your google email "mymail.google.com"
    Number5: Password It is your password to login to the server EX: my password to google

    Create SMTP from your host
    1. Log into your cPanel account.
    2. In the "Email" section, click on the "MX Entry" icon.
    3. Under "Add New Record", select "Remote Mail Exchanger" from the drop-down menu.
    4. In the "Mail Server" field, enter the hostname or IP address of your SMTP server.
    5. Click "Add New Record" to save the changes.
    6. In the "Email" section, click on the "Accounts" icon.
    7. Click on the "More" button next to the email account you want to use with SMTP.
    8. Click on the "Configure Email Client" button.
    9. Click on the "Manual Settings" tab.
    10. Under "Outgoing Mail Server (SMTP)", enter the hostname or IP address of your SMTP server.
    11. Enter your full email address and password for the email account.
    12. Click "Save Changes" and you should be able to send emails using SMTP from your cPanel account.

    However, you can find many tutorials and videos on how to set up SMTP from cPanel by searching
    for it on a search engine like Google or YouTube. Additionally, you can also check the
    documentation provided by your web hosting provider.
